gw.document

Class DocumentCreationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.document.DocumentCreationInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.web.document.DocumentWebFileInfo
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DocumentCreationInfo

    public class DocumentCreationInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.guidewire.pl.web.document.DocumentWebFileInfo
    Encapsulates information about a Document entity currently being created in the UI.

    Document creation is a potentially complex process. Depending on the process being followed for a particular document, it could involve tracking a file uploaded by the user, new document contents created from a document template, or only some metadata fields. Further complicating the process is the possible presence or absence of the Guidewire Document Assistant control; if it is present, there is a set of information about the user's machine (location of temp files, etc) which also needs to be tracked.

    The DocumentCreationInfo class gathers all of these details into a single object. It should not be used outside of the document creation UI.

    Author:
    Bryan Johnson

      • DocumentCreationInfo

        public DocumentCreationInfo(Document document,
                    DocumentCreationInfo.GlobalContextProducer producer)
        Create a new DocumentCreationInfo instance, with the given Document entity to hold the metadata and the producer to set up the global context. The values set in the global context will not change even after the reset.
        Parameters:
        document - document entity for the new document being created
        producer - the producer to set up the global context

    • Method Detail

      • getDocumentFilePath

        public java.lang.String getDocumentFilePath()
        Gets the full path on the user's machine of the temp file containing the contents of the new document. May not always be available, depending on whether the Guidewire Document Assistant is enabled.
        Returns:
        If available, the full path on the user's machine of the file containing the contents of the new document

      • getFile

        public WebFile getFile()
        Get the WebFile holding the contents of the newly created document. The contents are not stored to the document management system until the end of the process; in the meantime, the are held in the WebFile object.
        Specified by:
        getFile in interface com.guidewire.pl.web.document.DocumentWebFileInfo
        Returns:
        The WebFile holding the contents of the newly created document.

        Parameters:
        file - The WebFile holding the contents of the newly created document.

      • setFile

        public void setFile(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String mimeType,
           java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        Set the WebFile holding the contents of any document that is in the input stream. The contents are not stored to the document management system until the end of the process; in the meantime, the are held in the WebFile object.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the document
        mimeType - MIME type of the document
        inputStream - inputstream that holds the content

      • getDocumentTemplateDescriptor

        public IDocumentTemplateDescriptor getDocumentTemplateDescriptor()
        Get the IDocumentTemplateDescriptor to be used to create the new document contents for this document.
        Returns:
        The IDocumentTemplateDescriptor to be used to create the document contents.

      • setDocumentTemplateDescriptor

        public void setDocumentTemplateDescriptor(IDocumentTemplateDescriptor documentTemplateDescriptor)
        Set the IDocumentTemplateDescriptor to be used to create the new document contents for this document. For any fields on the document template descriptor which match up with fields on the DocumentBase entity (based on name), the values in the given document template descriptor fields will be copied over to the DocumentBase entity stored in this DocumentCreationInfo object.
        Parameters:
        documentTemplateDescriptor - The IDocumentTemplateDescriptor to be used to create the new document contents.

        public java.lang.Object getContextObjectValue(java.lang.String contextObjectName)
        Deprecated. Use the exposed ContextObjectValueMap field instead
        Get the currently set value for a particular context object for use in creation of the new document contents from a template. See IDocumentTemplateDescriptor for more information on context objects.
        Parameters:
        contextObjectName - The name of the context object whose value is desired.
        Returns:
        The currently set value for that context object

      • getDocumentCreationScript

        public java.lang.String getDocumentCreationScript()
        Get the script, if any, which should be run on the user's machine as part of the document creation process. Whether or not the script is null will depend on the current stage of the document process and whether the Guidewire Document Assistant control is enabled.
        Returns:
        The script which should be run on the user's machine as part of the document creation process, or null if none is required.

      • setDocumentCreationScript

        public void setDocumentCreationScript(java.lang.String documentCreationScript)
        Set the script which should be run on the user's machine as part of the document creation process.
        Parameters:
        documentCreationScript - The script which should be run on the user's machine as part of the document creation process, or null if none is required.

      • setCommitRequested

        public void setCommitRequested(boolean commitRequested)
        Indicate whether the current Location should be committed once the new document contents have been uploaded. Required because the document contents are uploaded through a hidden frame, rather than through commit of the document creation Location.
        Parameters:
        commitRequested - True if the current Location should be committed once the new document contents have been uploaded, false otherwise.

      • getDynamicWidgetInformation

        public DocumentCreationInfo.DynamicWidgetInfo[] getDynamicWidgetInformation()
        Return the set of DynamicWidgetInfo objects which correspond to the set of context object values which must be specified to create a new document from a document template.

        See IDocumentTemplateDescriptor for more information on context objects.

        Returns:
        A set of DynamicWidgetInfo objects, one per context object in the document template.
